After dropping off your belongings, you will partake in an enchanting game drive through the greenery where you will stumble upon spellbinding animal sightings, including massive elephants roaming the bushveld, horned wildebeest galloping across the grass, and lazy lions lounging in the shade of acacias.

dayInfo.title: Zambezi National Park - Stunning Spectacles of Victoria Falls
dayInfo.description: Your stay in western Zimbabwe would be incomplete without visiting the remarkable natural phenomenon, Victoria Falls. You will join your guide after breakfast and transfer to viewing points lining the summit of the falls. You will look out over the world’s largest waterfall, a momentous sheet of falling water 1,708 meters wide that descends from the precipice of the towering Zambezi Gorge and crashes into the river below. The size and sheer majesty of this geological landmark are stunning, and you will feel the refreshing spray of its cool waters as it plummets into the gorge.

dayInfo.title: Zambezi National Park - Highlight Sightings along the Zambezi River
dayInfo.description: Zambezi National Park is teeming with wildlife for you to discover during safari tours, and there are few experiences quite as quintessential as a Zambezi River cruise to soak up the scenic splendors. This unique safari activity will share the riverside spectacles from a new vantage point, allowing you to capture wilderness sightings you may have yet to experience. From hippos swimming slowly in the shimmering water to the formidable sharp-toothed tigerfish racing through the river, Zambezi is home to a wealth of fascinating creatures you will adore discovering today.

dayInfo.title: Kasane - On the Doorstep of Chobe National Park
dayInfo.description: Kasane is the gateway to Chobe National Park, an endearing little town that will be the next destination on your unique safari escape in Botswana. You will arrive at a spectacular new lodge on the doorstep of the park, where you will find refuge beneath the tall trees overhanging your suite. Throughout your stay, you will explore as much of the reserve as possible and take in the stunning scenery and wonderful animal sightings during several game drives and other exciting safari activities.

dayInfo.title: Kasane - Meandering Chobe National Park
dayInfo.description: You will wake up to the sounds of animals ringing from the surrounding wilderness and enjoy a piping hot cup of coffee as you gaze out across your lodge’s breathtaking, untouched backdrop. After breakfast, you will head for the national park and wander across its sweeping emerald plains and stretching savannas. Within a 4x4 vehicle, you will access rugged and remote parts of the park where animals roam freely in abundance. Leopards hanging in the branches of acacia trees and giraffes picking leaves from their thorny limbs are some sightings you will cherish during your tours of Chobe.

dayInfo.title: Kasane - Gliding across Chobe’s Glistening Rivers
dayInfo.description: Chobe’s fascinating wildlife and wondrous wilderness can also be appreciated by boat, a charming way to slowly enjoy the pleasures of the serene environment and spot animals flourishing in the habitats flanking the park’s water system. You will be seated comfortably in a large boat as it glides gracefully across the glittering water, and you will feel the cool breeze against your cheeks as you snap up photographs of the bewitching scenes. You may spot massive elephant herds wallowing in the shallow waters and other magnificent animals retreating to the river banks for a sip of water.

dayInfo.title: Moremi Game Reserve - A Peaceful Retreat in Moremi
dayInfo.description: Last but not least is Moremi Game Reserve, arguably Botswana’s claim to wilderness fame. The established park is world-famous for offering an exceptional range of wildlife viewing opportunities within some of the country’s most enchanting wilderness environments. You will check into a gorgeous campsite shortly after arriving, kitted out with glamping tents, outdoor dining facilities, and a charming boma. In the evening, you will admire the landscapes unfolding from camp as you tuck into dinner during sunset and stargaze around the fire as the stars pierce the skies.

dayInfo.title: Moremi Game Reserve - Adventures across Moremi
dayInfo.description: Hot air ballooning is an optional activity for the adventurous at heart, allowing visitors to gaze upon Moremi Game Reserve from up in the clouds. Should you wish to partake in this activity, you will capture unforgettable photography of the sprawling landscapes and toast your adventure with a glass of champagne afterward. Today, you will explore more of the reserve with a professional ranger and spotter. Between the thicket and low-lying shrubbery, you will spot wild dogs barking as they scuttle across the park, big cats slowly pacing the open plains, and massive herds gathering quietly around water holes.

dayInfo.title: Moremi Game Reserve - Closely Connecting with the Wilderness
dayInfo.description: Moremi’s wilderness is most certainly its highlight, however, there is a wealth of activities to do across the staggering park that you may indulge in during your stay. Today, you may hike the shady paths weaving around the reserve to riverbanks where a captain will whisk you away in a traditional dugout canoe, known as a mokoro . This activity, distinct to Botswana, is an impeccable way of getting closer to nature than ever before, coming into contact with the various creatures inhabiting the riverside ecosystems. Your final full day in Moremi is all about getting totally in touch with your natural surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Moremi Game Reserve - Reflecting on Botswana’s Untouched Brilliance
dayInfo.description: The break of dawn will welcome a new day, and you will rise to the symphonic soundtrack of birds and bugs echoing from the flanking trees. As you tuck into a scrumptious breakfast, animals will come and go as they please and wander around the grasslands spreading from the edge of your patio. Scenes like these are typical of an African safari, highlighting what makes a tour of Botswana so special. As you pack your bags and ready yourselves for the flight home, you will think back on your vacation and reminisce about your riveting adventures on the African continent.

tourName: Signature Botswana Safari: Ultimate Two-Week Experience
placesVisited: Chobe National Park, Linyanti Reserve, Moremi Game Reserve, Jao Concession, Nxai Pan National Park
generalInfo: Bask in the beauty of changing landscapes on a two-week safari adventure through Botswana’s great wildernesses. Elephants fill the thick woodland as you begin your adventure in Chobe. Throughout your journey, you will witness wildlife migrating through predator-dominated channels, bringing endless drama in the exclusive Linyanti. Not only does this trip boast some of the most diverse and eclectic wildlife in the world, but it is also home to the lush Okavango Delta islands and mazy waterways in Moremi and Jao. Finally, visit Makgadikgadi, which has vast and shimmering salt pans for escaping into silence and solitude. This Botswanan safari will have you dreaming of your unforgettable experiences on this picturesque, African landscape for years to come.

dayInfo.title: Chobe National Park – Elephants as Neighbors
dayInfo.description: Gazing over the Chobe River, you will admire an elephant herd. Two playful youngsters will be pushing each other deeper as they use their trunks as snorkels. A matriarch carries with her an air of melancholy, and a few elephants have wandered off, causing some commotion with a nearby hippo pod. After a long drink, the elephants will venture off to be replaced by another herd and then another. In Chobe, you do not even need to be on safari to see these giants. Giraffes will be just as conspicuous, and it can feel like you are continuously surrounded by the largest of these land mammals. Getting to Chobe does take time, and after landing in Maun, you will transfer to a safari flight where you will enjoy views over the Okavango Delta on your journey north. When arriving in Chobe, it will be late, so you will check into a lodge along the river and spend your evening watching the elephants below. Begin planning your dream safari by connecting with one of our luxury African safari travel agents .

dayInfo.title: Chobe National Park – Cruising the River Channels and Exploring the Woodland
dayInfo.description: After an evening to rest and relax, the will safari really begin. Passing thousands of elephants, you will drive into the heart of the thick woodland where your camp can be found in a small clearing. Close your eyes and tune different senses into the landscape. Sounds will echo through, indicating proximity to a buffalo herd or grazing antelope. From Linyanti, which is the next destination, it will be essential to do your safari activities in the early morning and late afternoon while the animals are most active. Chobe is a little different as the pachyderms provide entertainment during all hours of the day. So, after a long flight, you will still have plenty of time to rest and refresh. Boat trips also provide downtime here. Cruising the Chobe River, you will pass great populations of elephants and hippos along with smaller antelope herds that drink tentatively. Just sit back on the boat’s outdoor deck and watch the show where you will experience the ease and tranquility of a water-based safari. You may spot lions here, but Chobe is not a destination for predators as the thick woodland and high grass makes them very difficult to spot. Instead, during these two days, you will have these giants as neighbors. Slowly, the supporting cast will reveal itself: zebra, wildebeest, buffalo, vervet and colobus monkeys, baboons, and antelope.

dayInfo.title: Linyanti Reserve – Exclusive Big-Game Safari with the Predators
dayInfo.description: By driving to Linyanti, you will experience how landscapes change. Woodland becomes punctured by swamps and open savannah, and lush rivers give way to muddy channels. The trails provide real adventure as they will prove to be slow and beautiful. Tracing a leisurely route, you will enter a block of private concessions that separate Chobe from Okavango. Wildlife moves freely between these two famous landscapes, using a channel that dissects Linyanti Reserve. After trekking this deep into the wild, you will notice the lack of other people and vehicles. These private concessions will be exclusive with access being restricted to those that are not actually staying in the concession. This means that you will experience no through traffic and a more peaceful environment for wildlife. Most of day four will be spent on a game drive into Linyanti with a nighttime game drive that will provide new encounters. Of course, you can not see very well when it is dark, but the smells will be evocative, and sounds will guide you onward. The driver will move slowly and stops regularly, cutting the engine so you can fully tune in to the wildlife around you. This time, the animals will come to you. So, stay still, silent, and a guide’s spotlight will spot out grazing herds. Then, you will turn a corner, and it will be impossible to predict what will be gazing up at you from the grass. Nighttime is also a good time to see cats on a hunt with leopards and lions prowling across the land. For days five and six, the safari program is flexible. Typically, you will be exploring in the early morning, late afternoon, and after dark. Photography hides provide secretive places to hang out, bringing dreamy close-ups with various animals. Elephants and giraffes still dominate, but you can feel how Linyanti is on a migratory route, especially when exploring around the Savuti Channel. Red lechwe will skip past in their hundreds, and beisa oryx will greet your eye. Buffalos will huff and puff throughout the evening, and zebra will gather in a blur of white and black stripes. All of this means food for the predators and Linyanti has one extra special highlight: wild dogs. Although increasingly endangered, these predators have a refuge in Linyanti. Guides know where multiple packs den, so it is easy to enjoy encounters. Trying to keep pace with the hunters, following a pack on a hunt will be magical. Here lies another advantage of safaris in private concession: you are permitted to travel off the trails. Going off-trail is essential for tracking the predators, both before and after a hunt. So, the guide will take you within a few meters of lions or close enough so you can spot leopard cubs that are high in a tree. Linyanti is one of Africa’s ultimate private concessions, and by going off the trails, it will be one of your most memorable animal encounters.

dayInfo.title: Moremi Game Reserve – The Very Heart of the Okavango Delta
dayInfo.description: Travel further south, and you will not be able to travel by land anymore. Water will take over as the Okavango Delta spills its bounty across the desert. Trails are washed away every year, so you must fly with dreamy views from the window as you transfer to the Moremi Game Reserve. Your camp will be located on the northern tip of Chief’s Island, which is the largest of all the Okavango islands. This central piece of the Delta offers food and water every month of the year, resulting in a remarkable wildlife density. The giants are here in vast numbers, and there are other mass populations as well, notably red lechwe and zebra. Year-round residents are joined by migratory arrivals, including herds that swim across channels to reach the island. From your camp, you can gaze out across the water. Wildlife hides in the surrounding trees. Nature sings a lullaby each evening, and there is nothing artificial here, and nothing to distort your connection to both the wilderness and wildlife. In Moremi, the safari will be adjusted to your preferences and interests. Game drives can be accompanied by short game walks, providing the trackers think it is safe enough. Motorboat and mokoro canoes will then bring a new angle. Over these two days, you will explore the land and waterways, piecing together both sides of the Okavango experience. By now, you will appreciate how each activity brings a different perspective. Game drives are a little noisy, so many animals will retreat from an approaching vehicle. This is not the case on walks or in a canoe as these activities often take you among herds, creating a 360-degree panorama of life. You will also appreciate how the safari always continues back at your camp. Each evening, you will sit around a fire, listening to the sounds, and watching animals drink from the river below.

dayInfo.title: Jao Concession – Water-Based Safari in Wetlands and Lagoons
dayInfo.description: Another short flight will bring more views across the Delta as channels snake out around palm-fringed islands. Seasonal flooding makes the landscape even more iconic, forming a labyrinth of narrow channels. There are no roads, and there is hardly even any land, just a handful of small islands that are populated by grazers and monkeys. This is the classic Okavango Delta landscape and safari experience with all the activities taking place on or in the water. New animals like sitatunga will now begin to blur into the landscape, and hippos can be seen more regularly, but in smaller pods. Motorboat rides are the equivalent to game drives, covering relatively large areas while following locations that have been radioed by trackers. Mokoro canoes are how indigenous people travel. Constructed from a single tree, these canoes are pushed down the channels by gondoliers. They are incredibly silent and serene, drifting past lush reeds and beneath palm trees. Such peaceful travel does not have an impact on animals. Sometimes, you will be just five meters away from all kinds of animals. Sometimes a lioness will peer at you with one open eye as she lounges on the bank. With water as a barrier, a mokoro means real intimacy, especially as you have no idea what will be hiding around each bend in the delta.

dayInfo.title: Nxai Pan National Park – Shimmering Adventure of the Makgadikgadi
dayInfo.description: You will south and admire how it all changes. Lush waterways are replaced by the Kalahari’s arid dust, and soon there will be nothing except the changing brown hues of an enormous desert. Out of this nothingness, something new will emerge. The landscape will turn white as you touch down beside the pans. There was once a lake the size of Switzerland here, and today, there is no longer any water, just a mirage of shimmering salt. In such a barren place, it is difficult for animals to thrive, but you do not come here for wildlife, you come to Nxai Pan for silence and solitude. This incredibly peaceful experience will give you the opportunity to reflect on all the safari excursions that you have experienced so far. The camp peers across the plains and the mirage will seem endless. You can explore on an all-terrain vehicle, following a handful of paths that separate the pans. Occasionally, a lone elephant will wander past. Out in the salt, you will come across meerkats, poking their heads from the ground. Mostly, there will be nothing, and such a space will produce a unique state of mind. Space dominates at nighttime as well, and the desert stars extend above you as your campfire crackles. After ten days on your safari, it will always seem like a shame to return to the modern world. Staying on Nxai Pan will keep you firmly in the wilderness, ensuring that you have some alone time before returning home.

dayInfo.title: Maun – Departure
dayInfo.description: It will be a short flight back to Maun this morning, which will then be followed by your international flight.

tourName: South Africa, Botswana, and Zimbabwe: From Cityscapes to Waterfalls
placesVisited: Cape Town, Mashatu Game Reserve, Thornybush Game Reserve, Victoria Falls
generalInfo: From the sparkling golden shorelines of Cape Town to the sweeping savannahs of Limpopo and the breathtaking deserts of Botswana to the pounding Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe, experience the best of Africa during this handpicked 13-day tour. Offering spectacular safaris in some of the continent’s most beloved reserves, this tour will share the scenes and wildlife encounters for which Africa is famous.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - South Africa’s Coveted Cosmopolitan
dayInfo.description: In Cape Town, clouds coat the crest of the iconic Table Mountain like a tablecloth and the sunshine dances off the golden beaches sweeping its coastline. The city is a dreamy destination nestled at the foothills of the mountain, composing one of South Africa’s most beloved cosmopolitans. You will touch down at Cape Town International Airport, meet your private transfer, and cruise through the cityscape to your delightful accommodation pinned in the heart of its buzzing districts. In the evening, you may stroll along Cape Town’s vibrant streets to see what makes the city tick.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - A Sip of South Africa
dayInfo.description: A trip to Cape Town would be incomplete without a visit to its elite wine estates peppering the Constantia Hills. Today, you will join your private transfer and head for the rolling emerald hills to indulge in the Cape Winelands collection of exquisitely crafted wines poured by sommeliers who will guide you through the tasting of each vintage. Accompanied by vistas of the cascading evergreen vineyards, charcuterie boards overflowing with delectable meats and cheeses, and a soundtrack provided by the birds, you will soak up the majesty of this esteemed trail while sipping on some of South Africa’s best wines.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Where Two Oceans Meet
dayInfo.description: Table Mountain’s summit soars above the skyline, beckoning visitors to ascend its mighty peaks. Today, you will transfer to the base of the mountain, where you will climb into a spacious cable car and zip to the apex of its precipice. Atop the mountain, views of the Western Cape will stretch as far as the eye can see. You will return to the ground and continue your exploration along the rugged Cape Peninsula, stumbling upon humble fishing villages overflowing with marine life and the meeting point of the Atlantic and the Indian Ocean, Cape Agulhas.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Wonderful Memories of the Western Cape
dayInfo.description: There is far too much to discover in and around Cape Town in just four days, so today is left free for you to decide how you wish to spend your final moments in the city. Whether you desire to marvel at the dazzling multi-colored homes of the Bo-Kaap or retreat to the landscaped lawns of the world-famous Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden, there is something for everyone in Cape Town. In the evening, you may indulge in cocktails on the terraces of rooftop bars and dine on gorgeously prepared South African delicacies at one of the many upmarket restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Mashatu Game Reserve - Welcome to the Land of Giants
dayInfo.description: In Botswana’s eastern parts, adventure is rife within the postcard-perfect safari scenes sweeping across the environment. In the heart of this region lies your next accommodation, a reserve dubbed the ‘Land of Giants’ as it is home to the largest herds of elephants on privately owned land in Africa. The reserve offers a regal touch in an otherwise desolate area ruled by fascinating animals and marvelous creatures such as lions, cheetahs, wildcats, and various birdlife. Boundless activities to explore the wilderness await your journey in southeastern Botswana.

dayInfo.title: Mashatu Game Reserve - Game Drives through Paradise
dayInfo.description: You will encounter the curious creatures residing in this breathtaking reserve each day in several thrilling ways. This morning, you will enjoy a cruise through the illustrious landscape before the sun has risen above the horizon and capture herds of mammals grazing the grassy parts while the sun turns the sky fiery orange. In the evening, you will witness an even more marvelous sunset while mighty elephants trudge to nearby watering holes and birds of prey descend to swoop up their dinner.

dayInfo.title: Mashatu Game Reserve - Surreal Safari Experiences
dayInfo.description: There are copious safari experiences to enjoy in Mashatu beyond game drives. Today, you may see the scenes from unique vantage points and capture images worthy of the cover of glossy magazines. If you wish to encounter flora and fauna up close, then you may relish a walking safari through the emerald bush. Otherwise, you may hop on horseback and wallow in the whimsy of the wilderness at a comfortable distance from the ground. However you choose to capture the majesty of Mashatu is entirely up to you.

dayInfo.title: Thornybush Game Reserve - Illustrious Moments in Limpopo
dayInfo.description: You will return to South Africa today, this time arriving at the beautiful Limpopo Province. Featuring expansive stretches of savanna, forest-green slices of woodland, and grassy sections of shrubland, the Thornybush Game Reserve is a diverse wildlife sanctuary you will be thrilled to explore during your stay. Today, you will make yourself comfortable at your new home away from home and enjoy the lavish amenities of your stunning accommodation stationed in the idyllic wilderness of South Africa. With dinner alongside vistas of the bewitching natural scenes, you will relish a peaceful evening with exquisite local cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Thornybush Game Reserve - Breathtaking Encounters with the Big Five
dayInfo.description: You will spend your first full day in Thornybush exploring the wondrous environments by 4x4 vehicle for unbridled views of the wildlife and plant life. From encounters with roaring lion prides to moments spotting rhinos wading in shallow watering holes, you will hope to witness every member of the Big Five during your morning and evening game drives. In the evening, you will gaze upon the bright twinkling stars that light up the night sky unhindered by light pollution present in cities. Such images will prove too remarkable for words.

dayInfo.title: Thornybush Game Reserve - Beautiful Images of South Africa’s Birds
dayInfo.description: Inhabited by more than 500 bird species, Thornybush is a paradise for bird lovers and bird watching enthusiasts alike. Today, you may join your knowledgeable ranger and set off on a spectacular bird watching safari through the forests and woodlands. From the comfort of your off-road vehicle, you will catch glimpses of the vibrant birdlife that nestles in the towering trees and hovers overhead while you cruise along the dirt roads. Returning to your resort this afternoon, you may enjoy a vitalizing spa treatment at your accommodations divine wellness center.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - A Quiet Place to Unwind
dayInfo.description: Today, you will transfer to the Mpumalanga International Airport and catch a plane to your final destination of the tour, Zimbabwe. Arriving in the stunning country of Zimbabwe, you will be whisked away to one of the destination’s most captivating highlights, Victoria Falls. You will stay a short way from the mesmerizing waterfall and spend your first moments in this wilderness paradise wallowing in the serenity of the unspoiled environment and total seclusion of your accommodation. In the evening, enjoy a sumptuous dinner under the stars while the sounds of nature surround you.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Spectacular Scenes of the Colossal Falls
dayInfo.description: With a full day of exploration ahead, you will set off in the morning to witness the wondrous wildlife that surrounds your stellar suite and composes the illustrious topography encompassing Victoria Falls. En route to the waterfall, you will capture enchanting images of creatures rummaging through the greenery and birds nestling in the trees. You will soon find yourself gazing upon the pounding silver streams of Victoria Falls, a natural monument of colossal beauty. In the evening, you will enjoy the river scenes from a different perspective as you watch the sunset while cruising along the Zambezi River.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Sara Mushe, Africa
dayInfo.description: The symphony of birds singing from your balcony and the orange glow of sunshine peering through your window will welcome a new day, and your final morning on the African continent. Take your time wallowing in the unspoiled beauty that surrounds your suite while sipping on a decadent cup of coffee before tucking into a hearty breakfast and packing your belongings. In a short while, you will be collected by your private transfer and taken to the airport where you will say Sara mushe, or goodbye, to Zimbabwe and begin your journey back home.

tourName: Southern Africa Trip of a Lifetime: Evocative Safari Experiences
placesVisited: Okavango Delta, Makgadikgadi Pans, Victoria Falls, Mana Pools National Park
generalInfo: Pristine ecosystems, untouched wilderness, and enchanting wildlife will bring your dream to life during your luxury 11-day African safari in Botswana and Zimbabwe. Travel the legendary branches of the Okavango Delta on a traditional moko in search of thirsty elephants, and then follow your private guide through the grasses of the Mana Pools for close encounters with playful wild dogs and grazing buffalo. From game drives to fishing excursions, specialist guides to opulent safari camps, your trip of a lifetime will immerse you in the unparalleled splendors of an African safari as you celebrate the spirit of the wild.

dayInfo.title: Okavango Delta - Arrive in Botswana’s Remote Wild
dayInfo.description: The Okavango Delta is one of the most extraordinary destinations in Africa. Stunning wildlife thrives along the marshy banks of the sprawling branches and is found in the distant call of leopard barks and the nightly whoop of a hunting hyena. Papyrus reeds sway in the gentle morning breeze, and the vast sands of the bordering Kalahari Desert offer a glimpse of the landscape on the close perimeter of the oasis of palm, acacia, sycamore fig, and mangosteen trees. After landing at the airstrip, your private transfer will escort you to the comforts of the Vumbura Plains safari camp. The luxurious grounds rise out of the diverse surroundings accentuated by opulent tents with private plunge pools and views open to the wafting reeds nestled between the banks of the delta’s iconic channels. For an introduction to your camp and the splendor of the ecosystem, you can experience a mokoro safari by boarding the traditional dugout canoe with an experienced guide and skipper. The canoe has become a symbol of the Delta as it spans nearly 20 feet in length and offers a unique view of the wilderness and wildlife from the sunken perspective of the water. Your guide will steer you down the channel quietly gliding on the water as the aroma of Jacaklberry trees fills the air. You may spot the Bradfield’s hornbill perched on the strands of grass. The bird can grow up to 22 inches tall and can have yellow eyes with a red beak.

dayInfo.title: Okavango Delta - Discover the Exceptional Wildlife
dayInfo.description: For an active exploration of the Okavango Delta, you can follow your guide on a private fishing excursion in search of the legendary tigerfish. Travel along the vast flood plains to reach the Okavango River's main waters as a healthy population of tigerfish hides in the serene ambiance of rippling water. The morning breeze may brush through the bordering grass as birds like the African fish eagle and Pel’s fishing owl swarm overhead. Your experienced guide will help lead you through catching a tigerfish, from their location to their power, stemming from their size of weighing up to 62 pounds and reaching more than 41 inches long. In the evening, you can venture out into the delta's protected landscape with a guided game drive in search of the famous wildlife spread along the edges of the prized waterway. Your guide will help point out the animals more active around sundown when the day’s heat fades. You may spot a pod of hippos peering from the water. A single hippo can hold its breath for up to five minutes and spends up to 16 hours a day in the water protected from the sun’s rays.

dayInfo.title: Okavango Delta - Indulge in Luxurious Wilderness
dayInfo.description: In the morning, explore the vibrant ecosystem of the Okavango Delta with a morning game drive before sunrise. The wildlife of the region is most active before the heat of the day sets in for the best possibilities to spot animals. With luck, you may spot a male lion prowling the banks of the river. The Okavango lion may be the largest lion on the planet, thriving in the ecosystem known for an abundance of Cape buffalo and accessible prey. You can discover more of the rich diversity of the Okavango Delta in the late afternoon as you take to the skies with a hot-air balloon safari. Your ride can take you into the air up to 3,000 feet high for an expansive panorama sweeping across the water, plains, and desert along the horizon. You can sip champagne as you scour the landscape below for signs of elephant troupes, buffalo herds, wandering zebras, and scattered red lechwe antelope..

dayInfo.title: Makgadikgadi Salt Pans - Revel in Dynamic Views
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will take you to the airstrip after your morning game drive and breakfast to begin your travels to the Makgadikgadi Salt Pans. The dry savanna sweeps across the northeastern region of Botswana to form the world’s largest network of saltpans that overtake approximately 1,505 square miles. During the dry season, the light spreads across the sun-baked landscape for the salt to glint throughout the day, giving way to salt ponds and thriving waterbirds in the wet season. You will reach Jack’s Camp for a comfortable and luxurious stay in the heart of the Kalahari Desert. Palm trees tower over the tented vintage safari camp and pool pavilion for an immersion into remote opulence with lavish views of the wilderness. After settling into the beauty of your secluded surroundings, you can enjoy an intimate wildlife experience with a guided meerkat walk. Your guide will understand the meerkats’ social system and the setting resulting in a burrow on a modest mound to give the lookout higher ground when searching for predators or available food. The colony can grow to up to 30 meerkats and spread around an area of nearly two square miles. Finding the curious and gregarious colony in the arid landscape offers your first glimpse of natural wonder around the protected salt plans.

dayInfo.title: Makgadikgadi Salt Pans - Embrace the Unique Terrain
dayInfo.description: Venture next to the open plains of the Central Kalahari guided by the expertise of the Zu’Hoasi Bushmen. As you walk through the arid grasses, the scent of herbs may fill the air as you listen to the legends of the region and the ancient histories of the community living in harmony with the wilderness and wildlife. You may feel like you have stepped back in time as you step through the remote wilderness, well insulated from the fast-paced modern world. The Bushmen will reveal their traditional methods for hunting and gathering food and how they make jewelry from the shell of an ostrich egg. Learn to recognize which trees have water as they rise out of the saltpans before leaving the saturated pulp for other wildlife, revealing the community's symbiotic relationship with its surroundings. You can venture out into the landscape once more with a guide eager to show you the renowned Fallen Baobab, one of the largest and oldest trees in Africa. The landmark was over 1,000 years old and had a circumference of 82 feet. You may find the initials of the 19th-century explorer David Livingstone carved into the trunk representing a marker on the path of the renowned adventurer of African colonial history. Regional legend claims the tree may have fallen but remains alive, embodying the hardened spirit and mythical allure of the Botswana landscape.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Delight in Victoria Falls’ Beauty
dayInfo.description: You will fly from the Kalahari Desert to the roaring sounds of Victoria Falls with your private transfer meeting you at customs upon your arrival in Zimbabwe. The marvels of the world’s largest waterfall stem for the sheer size of the cascade, the volume of water, and the natural grandeur of the surrounding scenery bordering the mile-long curtain of water fed by the Zambezi River. You will find comfort in the luxuries of the Victoria Falls Hotel, an Edwardian vision of five-star opulence that combines modern comforts with the elegance of Old-World design. Palm trees tower over the quiet lily ponds, and tropical greenery contrasts the hotel’s pearly-white facade. After relaxing in the grand beauty of your room, follow your private pathway for a rewarding view of Victoria Falls that can rise to over 1,300 feet during the wet season and is often accentuated by the thunderous crash of the water audible from up to nearly 25 miles away. For an exceptional view of the scenery, you can enjoy a scenic helicopter flight for a serene panoramic view that features the waterfall’s 355-foot drop.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools - Uncover the Zambezi Valley’s Charms
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will escort you from the luxuries of your hotel to the airport for your flight to Mana Pools National Park, a rugged corner of northern Zimbabwe that rises out of the banks of the Zambezi River. The rich biodiversity thrives around the riverbanks for one of the greatest game-viewing areas in Africa with crocodiles, zebras, hippos, and elephants. Wildlife roams around the tall grasses for lion sightings or sprinting cheetahs, playful wild dogs, or lounging leopards divided by acacia trees. Your private transfer will take you to Ruwsi Canoe Trails for a memorable adventure steeped in luxury with unparalleled views of the wilderness. Your guide will meet you at the edge of the water for an introductory canoe ride along the Zambezi River, the fourth-largest river in Africa. You will travel at a relaxed pace, gliding down the water to reach the Little Vundu, a tented luxury safari camp. The private concession offers comfortable views over floodplains as the aroma of marshy grasses fills the air. As you float down the river, your guide may point out a white-fronted bee-eater as it snatches a passing insect. The colorful bird can grow up to nine inches long and shines with green back feathers and a cinnamon hue on hits chest. Their deep squeak may become the soundtrack to your canoe ride accompanied by the rhythmic sound of the paddle hitting the river.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools - Experience the Marvels of Wildlife
dayInfo.description: Set out on your private morning game drive with your specialist guide for an immersion into the grandeur of the wilderness. You may hear the nasal bark of African skimmer as it searches for fish on the glassy water, as your senses align to the wild. The award-winning guides of Ruwsi Canoe Trails are recognized for their specialized service and unique experiences. The open vehicle will give you opulent views of the surrounding landscape as you search for the remarkable wildlife of the region. You may find herds of elephants crossing the shallow waters of the river in the soft morning light. Witnessing the grace and size of an elephant in its natural habitat will reveal the distinctive beauty of your experience as the elephants tower up to 10 feet tall. After an evening game drive where you can search for leopards and honeybadgers, you will return to the camp for a night under the pristine starlight far from any possible light pollution. Among the sound of the crackling fire, you savor the noise of the wild as animals like aardvarks and frogs hunt around you.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools - Wander the Expansive Wilderness
dayInfo.description: You will have plenty of opportunities to explore the wilderness before sunrise as you join your specialist guide for an early excursion into the untamed landscape. You might opt to set out on a guided bushwalk for a more intimate experience. As you search for wildlife, both big and small, your guide can demonstrate techniques to trace nearby animals. Your guide may point out the common tiger snake hidden in a tree. They can grow up to three feet long with colorful scales reminiscent of tiger stripes shining pale yellow or orange. As you travel through the brush, you may also encounter a rare pack of wild dogs. They can grow up to 16 inches long and live in packs of up to 40 dogs. You may expect the pack to bark or growl at pretty but be surprised by the yipping sound they make instead. They have strong social bonds and often play in the cool air of the early morning or late evening. Your experience with a private specialist may not only inform your walk through the landscape but your entire experience in the African wilderness.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools - Enjoy the Hallmarks of the Region
dayInfo.description: In the early hours of the morning, you may hear wildlife outside of your camp along the lush floodplains of the Lower Zambezi River. Wake to the distant view of the water that winds along the base of the Zambian hills, perfect for taking in the breadth of elephants and hippos from the comforts of your private view. On your final day inside Mana Pools National Park, you will again have access to a specialist guide eager to find more captivating sights of lions, crocodiles, and zebra. As you set out on your safari, experience the harmony of the biodiversity with ebonies and baobab trees, wild figs, and mahogany flanking the river frontage and pools. You may find a herd of cape buffalo grazing on the verdant grasses, the largest of Africa’s wild bovid species. They can grow to over 11 feet long and weigh around 2,200 pounds. Their unpredictable temperament makes them a formidable opponent on the open plains, while their heard size could grow up to 500 individuals making them one of the most dangerous animals in the African bush.

dayInfo.title: Mana Pools - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the early morning, you may find zebras pulling the grass from the edges of the riverbank. Their bold strips will glint in the sunlight as you enjoy the aroma of fresh coffee and pastries in the comfort of your luxury camp. After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you at camp and escort you to the nearby airstrip. The transfer will feel like one more game drive as you travel once more through the untamed wilderness of Mana Pools National Park to reach your flight bound for Harare Airport, bringing an end to your luxurious and unforgettable trip of a lifetime.

tourName: VIP Okavango Safari Tour: Private Concessions & Lodges
placesVisited: Maun, Okavango Delta, Khwai Concession, Moremi Game Reserve, Duba Plains, Selinda Concession, Chobe National Park
generalInfo: The Okavango wilderness meets contemporary luxury when you stay in the Delta's private concessions and exclusive lodges. Big game wildlife extends in every direction, and you're miles from civilization, but there's still a wonderful sense of opulence. This 11-day safari is for those seeking an authentic Okavango safari with the reassurance provided by lavish private lodges. Stay in private concessions, try all the safari activities, see all the wildlife, and soak up Botswana's exclusivity.

dayInfo.title: Khwai Concession – Introductions to the Okavango Floodplains
dayInfo.description: The iconic Okavango impression is of flooded channels and marooned islands, of a landscape where hippos barge past elephants on the banks. It's this postcard image that you find at the Khwai Concession, one of the oldest gazetted areas within the Delta ecosystem. For over 30 years, your river lodge has provided a luxurious base within its local concession, with canvas chalets dotted amongst leadwood trees. Space is paramount here, with each chalet linked by a long wooden walkway above the floodplain. Delightful views come from your private verandah, an opulent en-suite bathroom is nothing like preconceptions of Africa, and the central area includes a lounge, bar, and stylish dining area. Today you land at Maun International Airport, where you're assisted in transferring to a light aircraft. Part of your camp's exclusivity is its inaccessibility. You cruise above the channels, taking in surreal expressions of nature. Even from the air, the Delta extends beyond the horizon in every direction. Land at your lodge in the late afternoon, where you enjoy a spa treatment on your verandah. As a masseuse alleviates any travel aches, you're getting introduced to the Okavango floodplains, gazing out at passing elephant herds and congregations of wild antelopes. The evening is at your leisure, with dinner beneath the stars in the main part of the camp.

dayInfo.title: Khwai Concession – Game Drives Through the Okavango
dayInfo.description: After a light breakfast, you're out on a game drive in an open-sided vehicle. Buffalo graze beside the track, a mass of black staring you right back in the eye. Beneath a tree, you spot a lion pride, complete with playful cubs interrupting their mother's sleep. Drive along the riverbank and hippos are everywhere, some opening their jaws with an iconic yawn. Next, it's a zebra herd, cantering beneath trees where giraffes feed. A first game drive is packed with new impressions and today is all about trying to take them all in. You return to the lodge by late morning, enjoying a hearty brunch before a serene few hours resting. Then a second game drive leaves after afternoon tea, staying out until the last light of the day is fading away. These game drives will explore both Khwai Concession and the adjacent Moremi Game Reserve.

dayInfo.title: Moremi Game Reserve – Luxury in the Wild Heart of the Okavango
dayInfo.description: Fly above the Delta, following the serpentine curves of the water. Channels wind past marooned sandbanks while large herds dot the landscape. It's a short flight to the northwestern edge of Chief's Island, where another of Botswana's flagship lodges awaits. Elevated wooden walkways lead you to a delightful suite, where comfy sofas are perfect for sitting back and watching the wildlife pass by. Plunge pools offer a unique place to view the big game and your suite is raised far off the ground, providing an extra layer of reassurance given the density of wild animals found nearby. Located on the Moremi Game Reserve, rather than its own concession, but the remarkable abundance of wildlife helps it maintain an exclusive feel: with so much to see, visitors are widely spread. This is one of the Okavango's most fertile stretches, and the game drives provide insatiable encounters with predators, especially lions. On an afternoon excursion, you approach a pride. The male yawns, then drifts to sleep with one eye open. Three lionesses elegantly wake up, wandering slowly to the safari vehicle before stretching out in the shade of the back wheel. At the channel, you see another pride drinking, the males' flowing manes gently reflected in the water. Then the iconic sight, lionesses lurking in the grass as they stalk a small herd of red sitatunga. Stop. Be patient. And watch the scene slowly unfold: lions stalking with menace, antelope grazing with trepidation, an explosion of dust as the hunt takes place and a young calf is separated from the herd. After the drama of the wild, your lodge provides an indelible base to bring the heartbeat down.

dayInfo.title: Moremi Game Reserve – Immersed in the Wilderness
dayInfo.description: An opulent lodge-style accommodation offers a serene counterpoint to the wilderness. For example, this morning you head off at dawn, exploring when the Okavango is at its most vibrant. Hippos are out of the water, munching across the grasslands. Vervet monkeys are squawking, alerting everyone to a leopard that's hiding nearby. Very rare black rhinos might be seen, the bashful mammals grazing openly in the sunrise light. These sights are never standalone. Everything is interacting, creating a theater that's defined by drama. But return to the lodge and all is calm. Animals still flicker past, but the theater is one of elegance and tranquility. You get to rest and relax, savoring the escapism of the Okavango. Contemporary luxury ensures you have every possible comfort. And then a zebra herd grazes beneath your suite, a reminder that you are charmingly immersed in the wilderness. In the afternoon, you head out on a second game drive, which is followed by another relaxed dinner at the lodge.

dayInfo.title: Vumbura Reserve – Crossing the Okavango By Boat
dayInfo.description: The Okavango Delta can be seen from space, its lush blue floodplains stretching far across the Kalahari Desert. Most of it is inaccessible. Sandbanks are isolated, leaving behind marooned herds. Palm islands are created, while wild palm plantations are slowly submerged. It's majestic when seen from the air; it's bafflingly complex when discovered from the water. Today, you travel by motorboat to the Duba Plains, crossing the water to the northern fringes of the Okavango. Zebra spray up water as they gallop on the banks, hippo pods fill the channels with their boisterous antics, and wandering nomads rise above the surrounding grasslands. You get a true sense of how big and expressive the Okavango really is. It's roughly a three-hour journey, but don't think of this as a transfer. Instead, it's a vivid Okavango motorboat safari. Your next property is located in the private Vumbura Reserve, amidst a landscape of floodplains, woodland, and tiny palm islands. A modern luxury tent lodge that evokes classic African safari styles of the 1920s, all is designed to blend with the surrounding trees, each tent has a private plunge pool, large wooden deck, and a covered sala (pavilion) for private dining. There are only five luxury tents, so an air of exclusivity and service is always maintained, especially when drinks are served as the sun disappears over the Okavango. You should arrive at lunchtime before the afternoon provides a game drive through the private reserve.

dayInfo.title: Vumbura Reserve – Luxury Safari and Diverse Activities
dayInfo.description: Wildlife is everything in Vumbura. Lionesses hide away their cubs before hunting for buffalo. Impala and tsessebe elegantly grace the plains. Pink pelicans and red-billed hornbills provide additional color. The open plains are ideal for cheetah and wild dogs, relatively rare hunters that provide some of safari's most hypnotic sights. Spotted hyenas scurry past while leopards drape their spots across the woodland. Elephants, giraffe, crocodiles, kudu, wildebeest; Vumbura always impresses with its variety and density of wildlife. After six days on safari, coming here ensures that you're constantly enjoying fresh sights. This is complemented by the variety of activities. There are few restrictions in a private reserve, so you can create a personal program from the menu of excursions. Short game walks are accompanied by armed trackers, getting you thrillingly close to the plains' antelopes. Silently explore in a mokoro , a traditional wooden canoe that's paddled along the channels. Or continue yesterday's experience with a motorboat safari. Or you can stay out into the evening on a nighttime game drive, admiring nocturnal animals that emerge from their dens. At this camp, you get to try it all, each activity offering a new atmosphere and experience in the same landscape.

dayInfo.title: Selinda Concession – Exclusivity and Opulence in the Selinda Reserve
dayInfo.description: After the flight, you take an afternoon game drive through the concession, aquatinting yourself with a new landscape, one that's dominated by giants. Elephant and giraffe are everywhere while lions continue to provide their daily charm. Towards the late afternoon, you cruise ona private pontoon, a relaxed sunset boat journey that brings intimacy with hippos, elephants, and a wide variety of birdlife. A bateleur eagle swoops overhead while guineafowl roost in jackalberry trees. This sunset boat cruise is available on each of your days in Selinda and the camp only has eight guests, so the activities always have an air of exclusivity. Elephant and giraffe are everywhere while lions continue to provide their daily charm. Towards the late afternoon, you cruise on a private pontoon, a relaxed sunset boat journey that brings intimacy with hippos, elephants, and a wide variety of birdlife. A bateleur eagle swoops overhead while guineafowl roost in jackalberry trees. This sunset boat cruise is available on each of your days in Selinda and the camp only has eight guests, so the activities always have an air of exclusivity.

dayInfo.title: Selinda Concession – Game Drives and Game Walks
dayInfo.description: The Selinda Concession is at a crossroads, connecting the diverse realms of the Okavango and Chobe. After eight days on safari, you already know a lot about the Delta, about how the water brings diverse life to the Kalahari Desert. To the south and west of Selinda lies the Okavango Delta, while to the north and east is Chobe National Park, a thick woodland ecosystem that's a favorite of the pachyderms. Chobe is home to Africa's largest elephant population, along with vast numbers of other forest dwellers. Connecting these two ecosystems is the Magwegqana Spillway, a sunken landscape of savannah, sporadic islands, and diverse vegetation. It's a natural migration route, while also a bountiful home for a wide number of species. And it's the heart of the Selinda Concession. So even after nine or ten days of safari, you'll keep seeing new sights. Just like in Vumbura, the private concession enables you to create a flexible itinerary, with private game walks and drives in the day and night. Epic predator-prey encounters play out, particularly between lion prides and buffalo. The lions attack but the herd responds, charging in unison, their rumbling hooves scaring off the hunters. Resident leopards provide daily delight while two wild dog packs chase down large herds of zebra. Elephant calves are everywhere, swinging their trunks as they surround the safari vehicle with charm. Sometimes it's hard to keep track, with so many giants in a relatively compact area. Safari here also provides a contrast to your other Okavango stops as you can head deep into vast woodland. The thrills increase as the visibility decreases. Sounds echo through the trees and then you turn a corner to find their origin: a 50-strong elephant herd bashing their rumps against the trunks, trying to dislodge the fruit.

dayInfo.title: Selinda Concession to Maun – Departure
dayInfo.description: Your final morning is easy and relaxed, a last chance to sit on the verandah and say hello to the passing herds. In the middle of the morning, you'll be transferred to the Selinda airstrip for a flight across the Okavango to Maun, where a representative assists in transferring you to your international departure.
